revised_title: The Influence of Host Environment on Microbial Pathogenicity
tldr: The author discusses the importance of studying microbes in their natural host environment to understand their pathogenicity and virulence. They highlight three studies that demonstrate the influence of host factors on the production of virulence determinants in bacteria, such as iron limitation, erythritol, and CMP-NANA. The author emphasizes the need to examine bacteria grown in vivo to better understand and combat microbial diseases.
